title: How to Make Poisson Cru (E'ia Ota)

steps.headline: Slice the fish into three-quarter inch pieces.
steps.description: Next, drench them in cold water and 2 tablespoons (29.6 ml) salt. Get out a few ice cubes if the water is not chilled yet. Allow the fish to soak for 20 minutes, and juice the limes by squeezing them.

steps.headline: Drain out the fish; allow it to dry and pat it dry as well.

text: Slice the fish into three-quarter inch pieces. Next, drench them in cold water and 2 tablespoons (29.6 ml) salt. Get out a few ice cubes if the water is not chilled yet. Allow the fish to soak for 20 minutes, and juice the limes by squeezing them. Drain out the fish; allow it to dry and pat it dry as well. Completely cover it in fresh lime juice; there needs to be between three-quarters of cup and one cup to drench it. Marinate the fish and stir every now and then for 15 minutes.  Get the vegetables ready during the fish's marinating process. Use any of the vegetables above, or even all of them; save a little of each on the side to be garnished. Continue letting the fish marinate until the edges are not transparent and each piece's center is pink. Drain out the lime juice, and bring the fish back to the bowl. Stir the coconut milk and vegetables, and add salt and pepper for seasoning to taste. Then, let it all marinate in the refrigerator for about half an hour. Serve the mixture cold and add more fresh vegetables. Coconut rice is recommended with it if you'd like a more filling meal.
